video:video.video:title: Lync Server 2013: Register a managed code application

video:video.video:title: Launch an executable with a Lync custom menu
video:video.video:description: Learn how to add a custom menu item to the UI of the 32-bit version of Lync 2013. The menu item in this video starts an executable. The Web application example appears in Launch a Web application with&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Lync 2013: Translate a conversation from one language to another in real time, part two

video:video.video:title: Lync 2013: Start a conversation and manage control of a shared resource, part two

video:video.video:title: Lync 2013: Start a conversation and manage control of a shared resource, part one

video:video.video:title: Lync 2013: Start an IM Conversation
video:video.video:description: This video describes and demonstrates a sample application that shows how to start a new conversation with a Lync contact.

video:video.video:title: Lync 2013: Show the contact list of a user in a WPF application
video:video.video:description: This video describes and demonstrates a sample application that shows how to create a Lync contact list control, and how to retrieve the URI of a selected contact.

video:video.video:title: Lync 2013: Content Sharing: File attachments

video:video.video:title: Use Speech Recognition to Drive an IM Broadcast
video:video.video:description: See how you can easily and quickly build a Lync 2010 middle-tier application that will receive a phone call, and broadcast an IM message to a distribution list based on the content of the call.

video:video.video:title: Transferring Files with UI Suppression
video:video.video:description: See how to use C# code and the Microsoft Lync 2010 SDK to perform file transfer from a Lync client application when the Lync UI is suppressed.

video:video.video:title: Create a Call Center Application
video:video.video:description: This video demo shows how to use the Microsoft Unified Communications Managed API (UCMA) 3.0 Core SDK, and the Microsoft Lync 2010 SDK to build a simple call center application. The application&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Create and Use a Lync Silverlight Control
video:video.video:description: This demonstration shows how you can use a Silverlight class library and the Lync 2010 SDK to build your own custom Lync Silverlight controls.

video:video.video:title: Create and Use a Lync WPF Control
video:video.video:description: This demonstration shows how you can use a WPF User Control and the Lync 2010 SDK to build your own custom Lync WPF controls.

video:video.video:title: Sign In to Lync
video:video.video:description: This demonstration shows how to use Model API code and the Microsoft Lync 2010 SDK to sign a client application in to Lync 2010 where the Lync user interface is not suppressed.

video:video.video:title: Start an IM Conversation
video:video.video:description: The demonstration video demonstrates how to start an instant messaging conversation using the Lync 2010 SDK Model API. This process involves creating a Conversation instance using the&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Sign In to Lync with UI Suppressed
video:video.video:description: See how to sign a client application in to Microsoft Lync 2010 when the application UI is suppressed; and also see how a client application signs a user out of Microsoft Lync 2010 and shuts Lync down&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Using VoiceXML in a UCMA 3.0 Core Application
video:video.video:description: The UCMA 3.0 Core SDK can be used to create applications that interpret VoiceXML documents. In this video, Mark Parker demonstrates a VoiceXML document with embedded Javascript, and shows the UCMA 3.0&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Add, Rename, and Delete Custom Groups in Lync
video:video.video:description: See how to use the Microsoft Lync 2010 SDK to add, rename, and delete Lync custom groups. This demo is related to the MSDN Library topic 'Walkthrough: Add, Remove, and Rename Custom Groups'. Sample&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Running UCMA Code in a Windows Workflow Application

video:video.video:title: Managing Security for Lync SDK Applications
video:video.video:description: See a short description of Lync application security issues, and a demonstration of using the trusted sites list for Lync Silverlight applications.

video:video.video:title: Lync Contextual Data Part 3: Passing an Image File
video:video.video:description: Learn how to pass an image file as contextual data in a Lync conversation.

video:video.video:title: Localizing Lync Control Applications
video:video.video:description: See a demonstration of localizing a Lync control application into French.

video:video.video:title: Lync Contextual Data Part 2: Methods and Events
video:video.video:description: See how to build a pair of sample applications that will exercise the methods and events used to send and receive the two types of Lync contextual data: initial context data and context data.

video:video.video:title: Add Lync Controls to a Web Application
video:video.video:description: Learn how to add Silverlight controls providing Microsoft Lync 2010 functionality and user interface to an existing Web application.

video:video.video:title: Lync Contextual Data Part 1: Send Data With An IM Message
video:video.video:description: See how to use the Microsoft Lync 2010 SDK to add contextual data to IM messages.

video:video.video:title: Add Presence to a WPF Application
video:video.video:description: See how easy it is to use the Microsoft Lync 2010 SDK to add Lync 2010 functionality and UI to a WPF application. For more information, see http://msdn.com/lync.
